Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 3

Intermediate

Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 3

Master these intermediate words to improve your academic writing and professional communication skills.

Navigation

This is page 3 of 15. Use the navigation below to explore all vocabulary pages.

Word List

Exclude

/ɪkˈskluːd/

verb

To deny someone access to or bar someone from a place, group, or privilege.

"The club decided to exclude harmful members."

Synonyms: omit, leave out, bar

Category: Action

Extensive

/ɪkˈstensɪv/

adjective

Covering or affecting a large area; having a wide scope.

"The library has an extensive collection of books."

Synonyms: broad, wide, comprehensive

Category: Size

Furthermore

/ˈfɜːrðərmɔːr/

adverb

In addition; besides (used to introduce a fresh consideration).

"The plan is expensive. Furthermore, it may not work."

Synonyms: moreover, additionally, besides

Category: Connection

Generate

/ˈdʒenəreɪt/

verb

To cause something to arise or come about; produce or create.

"The new marketing campaign will generate more sales."

Synonyms: produce, create, cause

Category: Creation

Guarantee

/ˌɡærənˈtiː/

noun, verb

A formal promise or assurance; to provide a formal assurance.

"The company offers a one-year guarantee on all products."

Synonyms: promise, assurance, warranty

Category: Promise

Hypothesis

/haɪˈpɑːθəsɪs/

noun

A supposition or proposed explanation made on the basis of limited evidence.

"The scientist tested her hypothesis through careful experiments."

Synonyms: theory, assumption, proposition

Category: Science

Illustrate

/ˈɪləstreɪt/

verb

To explain or make something clear by using examples, charts, pictures, etc.

"The teacher used diagrams to illustrate the concept."

Synonyms: demonstrate, show, explain

Category: Explanation

Implement

/ˈɪmplɪment/

verb

To put a decision or plan into effect.

"The school will implement new safety measures next month."

Synonyms: execute, carry out, apply

Category: Action

Indicate

/ˈɪndɪkeɪt/

verb

To point out; to show, point, or make clear in another way.

"The survey results indicate a growing concern about climate change."

Synonyms: show, suggest, reveal

Category: Evidence

Initiative

/ɪˈnɪʃətɪv/

noun

The ability to assess and initiate things independently; a new plan or process.

"She took the initiative to organize the charity event."

Synonyms: enterprise, drive, leadership

Category: Leadership

Nonetheless

/ˌnʌnðəˈles/

adverb

In spite of that; nevertheless.

"The weather was bad; nonetheless, we enjoyed our trip."

Synonyms: nevertheless, however, still

Category: Contrast

Obviously

/ˈɑːbviəsli/

adverb

Clearly; in a way that is easily perceived or understood.

"Obviously, we need to leave earlier to avoid traffic."

Synonyms: clearly, evidently, plainly

Category: Clarity
